intro: Tetratheca verticillata, commonly known as the mountain thornbush, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged in whorls. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Tetratheca verticillata is adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
